falter.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to become weaker and unable to continue in an effective way
falter.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The economy is showing signs of faltering.
My mother’s grip upon the household never faltered.
falter.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping
falter.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
falter.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to become less certain and determined that you want to do something
falter.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We must not falter in our resolve.
falter.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to stop walking or to walk in an unsteady way because you suddenly feel weak or afraid
